intro: Sisymbrium reflexum, commonly known as the hoary salsify, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features slender, branching stems that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnately lobed and covered with a powdery coating, giving them a distinctive appearance. Sisymbrium reflexum is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
